thread.title: Italy Qualifies for European Championship
thread.title_full: Italy Qualifies for European Championship - The New York Times

author: The Associated Press
title: Italy Qualifies for European Championship
text:
Stephan El Shaarawy ended a three-year drought by scoring the winning goal as Italy beat Azerbaijan, 3-1, Saturday to qualify for next year’s European Championship.
After Eder’s opener and an equalizer from Dmitri Nazarov, El Shaarawy finished off a counterattack in the 43rd for his first national team goal since November 2012. Manchester United’s Matteo Darmian added another for Italy in the second half.
Norway took a step toward qualifying for the tournament, which will be held in France, with a 2-0 win over Malta. Italy has 21 points in Group H, Norway is next with 19 and Croatia, which hosted Bulgaria later, is third with 14.
The Netherlands kept alive its hopes of qualifying by beating host Kazakhstan, 2-1. Midfielders Georginio Wijnaldum and Wesley Sneijder scored to ensure the fight for third spot in Group A goes down to the final round of qualifiers on Tuesday. Already-qualified Iceland tied Latvia, 2-2.
The top two finishers from the nine groups qualify automatically. The best third-place finisher also qualifies automatically, while the eight other third-place teams can reach the tournament through a playoff.
 On Soccer: Jurgen Klinsmann Stays the Course Despite a Chorus of Doubters OCT. 10, 2015 Javier Hernández’s Spirits Rise, as Mexico Prepares to Face U.S. OCT. 8, 2015 U.S. Sees FIFA as Victim and Its Leaders as Wrongdoers OCT. 9, 2015 Sports of The Times: With or Without Its Captain, FIFA Seems to Be Capsizing OCT. 8, 2015 Sepp Blatter and Other Top Officials Are Suspended, Deepening FIFA’s Turmoil OCT. 8, 2015 PLATINI APPEALS The European soccer leader Michel Platini lodged an appeal with FIFA against his 90-day suspension and was backed by the South American confederation, which called for him to be allowed to stand in the presidential election to succeed Sepp Blatter.
FIFA’s ethics committee imposed a provisional 90-day ban on Platini, the UEFA president, on Thursday after a payment he received from the world body became embroiled in a Swiss criminal investigation. Blatter was also suspended from his role as FIFA president. He filed an appeal Thursday.
